intro: Calendula lusitanica var. microcephala, commonly known as the dwarf calendula, is a compact, herbaceous perennial native to the Iberian Peninsula. It features bright orange to yellow flowers with a distinctive, rounded shape, and its foliage is covered in fine, downy hairs. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, making it ideal for rock gardens or containers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, blooming from late spring to early autumn. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
